content.p: Nottingham’s School of English is staffed by vibrant, international academics with a wide range of teaching and research experience. Staff and students work together to investigate a wide range of topics around the use of English in literature and in everyday language. We also investigate how language shapes, and is shaped by, the dynamic environments in which it is used. The School’s global footprint allows its graduate students to draw on the supervisory expertise of over eighty staff specialising in aspects of English studies across the three campuses, and to spend time in the UK and China. They also enjoy access to dedicated funds to cover research costs and attend local and international conferences. We encourage applications in any topic related to English Studies. Our current research topics include: If you are interested in doing an MRes, MPhil or PhD with the School of English, you may want to browse our online prospectus. telephone: +603 8924 8000 fax: +603 8924 8001
